Jarvis

System Management

HPC ecosystem management with package discovery, repository management, and resource monitoring. Provides comprehensive tools for managing HPC software environments.

1.0.0 Version
5 Actions
Jul 19 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Quick Start

cd /path/to/scientific-mcps/Jarvis uv sync && uv run jarvis-mcp

UV Package Manager

uv sync uv run jarvis-mcp

Traditional pip

pip install -e . cd src && python server.py

Direct Execution

uv run jarvis-mcp cd src && python server.py

Claude Desktop

{ "mcpServers": { "jarvis-mcp": { "command": "uv", "args": [ "--directory", "/path/to/scientific-mcps/Jarvis", "run", "jarvis-mcp" ] } } }

WARP Client

MCP: - Jarvis python3 bin/wrp.py --conf=bin/confs/Gemini.yaml

Available Actions

  • get_all_packages
    Get comprehensive list of all available packages in Jarvis ecosystem
    Parameters: None
  • get_package_info
    Get detailed information about specific packages including dependencies and versions
    Parameters: package_name
  • get_all_repos
    Get list of all configured repositories in the system
    Parameters: None
  • modify_repo
    Modify repository configuration and settings
    Parameters: repo_name, action, config
  • get_resource_status
    Get current status of HPC resources and system health
    Parameters: resource_type

Usage Examples

Package Discovery

get_all_packages() get_all_packages(package_type="application") get_all_packages(repository_filter="custom_repo") get_all_packages(sort_by="popularity") get_all_packages(include_descriptions=True, sort_by="name")

Package Information

get_package_info("incompact3d") get_package_info( "incompact3d", return_config_params=True, return_examples=True, return_dependencies=True ) get_package_info( "ior", return_description=True, return_outputs=True, return_performance_notes=True, summary_level="comprehensive" )

Repository Management

get_all_repos(include_health_status=True, include_package_counts=True) get_all_repos(show_priority_order=True) modify_repo( repo_name="custom_tools", operation="add", repo_path="/path/to/custom_tools" ) modify_repo( repo_name="custom_tools", operation="promote" )
